ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A master production schedule specifies
ENGLISH.OPT1: the on hand inventory, transit inventory, planned order and scheduled receipt.
ENGLISH.OPT2: how each final product is manufactured, specifying all subcomponent items and their sequence of build-up to the final product.
ENGLISH.OPT3: what product is to be produced, when it is to be produced and in what quantity.
ENGLISH.OPT4: the financial resources required for production.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A company uses simple exponential smoothing method for forecasting a product with smoothing coefficient as 0.65. The actual demand for the month of October and November are 940 units and 972 units respectively. If the forecast for the month of October was 860 units, the forecast for the month of December is

Four jobs A, B, C and E are to be processed on a machine as per data listed in the table below:

Which job has the highest critical ratio?

The optimum sequence to minimize the total make span of production is
Weighted moving average of forecasting is
A time scale is used for which of the following recording technique used for method study.

The maximum percentage defective that the consumer finds definitely acceptable is called
Quality function is the responsibility of
ENGLISH.OPT4: Every body working in the organization

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: The overall reliability of the following system is
An electric component has a uniform failure rate of 0.001 component per hour. The reliability of that component for a specified period of 500 hours is _____.

In the exponential smoothing method of forecasting, the smoothing constant(α) is given as where n is the number of period and p and q are constants. The value of p2 + q2 – pq is ______. (Answer in integer)
In a PERT network, critical path has 16 activities. If the standard deviation of each activity on the critical path is 2, the standard deviation of the critical path is ______. (Answer in integer)

An investment proposal requires an investment of Rs. 53,000. The cash flow expected to be generated uniformly through the period in different years are :

If the proposal is accepted, then the payback period (in years) is _____.

The following observations are given for an activity
Observed Time = 10 mins; Rating = 90%; Frequency = Relaxation Allowance = 15% of normal time.
ENGLISH.OPT1: Standard time for job is 10.35 mins.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Relaxation allowable for job is 0.054 mins.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Standard time for job is 0.414 mins.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Relaxation allowance for job is 1.35 mins.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: Which of the following aspect can be considered during design stage to reduce the cost of a product
ENGLISH.OPT2: Unnecessary tight tolerance should not be provided.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Design should consist of standard parts.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Design should consist of specialised parts.

Cost of machine = Rs. 150000
Scrap value = Rs. 45000

The following set of jobs are to be performed on three machines first on machine-I, then machine-II and then on machine-III. The machining time (in minutes) of the jobs are given below.

The optimum make-span (in minutes) is _______. (Answer in integer)

The following table gives the number of defectives found in the inspection of 15 lots of 400 items each.

The sum of upper control limit and lower control limit of an appropriate control chart considering ±3σ warning limit is ______.

A desired output of 900 units per shift (7.5 hours) is desired for a new processing system. The line requires 100 seconds to make a product. The line has four workstations arranged as per the required sequence of operations. At steady state, the line efficiency (in %) is _______.

The sales data of a product for 3 periods are

Assume that the forecast for period 1 is 440 units. Using an exponential smoothing method with smoothing constant, α = 0.2, the sales forecast (units) for period 4 is _______.

An operator manufactures 40 jobs in 6 hours and (This time include set up time) 20 minutes. The setting time required by the operator is 40 mins. Standard time for the job is 10 minutes per job. The efficiency of operator (in %) is _____.
The upper specification for limit for a component is 20.0 and lower specification limit is 18.2. If the process has a variance of 0.2, then the process capability index is _______.

It is desired to have a reliability of at least 0.95 for a specified service period of 10,000 hours on the assumption of a uniform failure rate. What will be the least value of mean time between failure (in hours) that yield the desired reliability is ______.

A system comprises of two subsystems, the system has to operate with a probability of success of 80% for 3000 hours. One of the subsystem has a probability of survival of 85% for 3000 hours. Choose the correct statement(s)
ENGLISH.OPT1: For 80% reliability of system for 3000 hours, the reliability of other subsystem is 88.23%.
ENGLISH.OPT2: For 75% reliability of system for 3000 hours, the reliability of other subsystem is 88.23%.
ENGLISH.OPT3: For 80% reliability of system for 3000 hours, the reliability of other subsystem is 94.11%.
ENGLISH.OPT4: For 75% reliability of system for 3000 hours, the reliability of other subsystem is 94.11%.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: In an assembly line with five work stations with assembly time 12, 14, 15, 18 and 17 minutes respectively has cycle time of 20 minutes. Which of the above statement(s) is/are CORRECT?
ENGLISH.OPT1: The smoothness index for line is 7.88 minutes.
ENGLISH.OPT2: The balancing delay for line is 24%.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The number of units produced is 8 hour shaft are 27 units.
ENGLISH.OPT4: The total work content is 76 minutes.
